job.description:
Who are we?
Audius is a digital streaming service that connects fans directly with artists and exclusive new music. 

It does this by being fully decentralized: Audius is owned and run by a vibrant, open-source community of artists, fans, and developers all around the world. Audius gives artists the power to share never-before-heard music and monetize streams directly. Developers can build their own apps on top of Audius, giving them access to one of the most unique audio catalogs in existence. 

Backed by an all-star team of investors, Audius was founded in 2018 and serves over 4,000,000 users every month, making it the largest non-financial crypto application ever built.

Who we are looking for?
We are looking for passionate team-players to help us architect and build the most difficult parts of the Audius protocol (high availability services for decentralized replication of data, latency-sensitive distributed file transfers, Ethereum smart contracts, infrastructure and tooling for third parties to run our open source services). You are a collaborative engineer who enjoys working with a small team to solve big problems that need innovative solutions. You’re eager to jump into multiple parts of our tech stack and have strong CS fundamentals to do so. We solve a lot of problems that can't be easily Googled or searched on StackOverflow.

Our Company
Audius is a 18-person team of entrepreneurs, engineers, audiophiles, and blockchain experts. Our benefits include unlimited PTO, high quality paid medical insurance, FSA, 401k, yearly learning stipend, equipment stipend and a home office setup credit. We also have a monthly concert credit (COVID-19 permitting).

Our company is fully remote forever and our team is currently distributed across the United States.

job.title: Experienced Blockchain Engineer (Remote, Europe only)
job.description:
Description

We're looking for an experienced Solidity engineer to help us bring Ethereum to millions more people with our Layer 2 launch. Our L2 wallet will be smooth, secure and have radically lower gas - all while keeping the unique experience Argent is known for.

We're aiming for a breakthrough in the global adoption of crypto.

  • On Layer 1, you'll help us integrate more Defi protocols to the existing Argent Vault which combines multisig security with one tap DeFi and protects over $1bn in assets.
  • On Layer 2, you'll help us bring our unique smart-contract model to key rollups. We're starting on zkSync but will expand to other L2s, such as Optimism, Starkware and Arbitrum afterwards.

For both initiatives you'll take ownership of the entire smart contract development lifecycle, including managing relations with partners and deploying the contracts to our test and production environments.

Requirements

Essential

  • 3+ years as a software engineer
  • 1+ years experience developing top tier smart contracts on mainnet
  • Deep understanding of Solidity, Assembly, and the EVM
  • Writing code that's clean, easy to audit, yet efficient in terms of deployment, execution and maintenance.
  • Experience with smart-contract patterns such as upgradability, proxy wallets, meta-transactions, and counterfactual deployment
  • Good knowledge of the L2 ecosystem, with a deep understanding of ZK and Optimistic rollups.

Nice to have

  • Passionate about the evolution of Solidity and the EVM
  • Being an active member of the dev community (e.g. experience contributing to EIPs)
  • Ability to work well with design, mobile platform and backend teams
  • Enjoys working on unfamiliar problems, challenging others and being challenged in turn
  • Knowledge of Rust, Javascript, Typescript or Node.js is a plus
Benefits
  • Work remotely - anywhere in Europe (but Europe only). No commute. Lots of flexibility. Plenty of time to care for your kids or cats.
  • Equity in a high growth startup backed by the investors of Spotify and Slack.
  • Autonomy - you decide how to achieve your best work.
  • Trips across Europe - for one week every three months we collaborate in person, explore new solutions and have fun. So far we’ve stayed in Nice, Toulouse, Brussels, Lisbon and Barcelona. We'll resume these when safe following COVID.
  • Equipment - pick the tech setup of your choice.
  • Parental leave - generous package for new parents.
  • Build a new industry - help define the future of the web.

Our values

You can find more information on each of our values here.

job.title: Technical Recruiter (Remote, Europe only)
job.description:
Description

Summary

We believe that the future of money and the internet should be more open and fair. That everybody should have equal access to economic opportunities, and that this brave new future is possible. It can be realised through crypto.

That's why we started Argent: the world's most simple and secure smart wallet. Empowering you to control and prosper from your digital assets and identity.

We launched in 2018 and are fortunate to be backed by Silicon Valley and Europe's top investors, including Paradigm, Index Ventures, Creandum and firstminute capital. We're now getting ready to bring crypto's benefits to millions more people.

As our first Technical Recruiter you'll spearhead our efforts to find and recruit the world's best engineers. To start, you'll help us grow from 23 to 40+ over the next 18 months. The roles will range across our engineering team, from the backend to the mobile clients.

Your sourcing will be data driven and systematic, recognizing that LinkedIn usually won't work for the calibre of engineer we want.

You'll report to the Head of Strategy & Operations.

The role

  • Proactively and efficiently build a pipeline of top tier talent, spotting hidden gems and tracking candidates for future opportunities too.
  • Ensure candidates have a great experience.
  • Successfully sell Argent to the most sought after candidates.
  • Identify candidates that fit our values.
  • Understand what offer packages are appropriate for Argent's stage and ambition.

Requirements

  • 3+ years recruiting experience at highly technical companies. Startup experience desirable.
  • Ability to differentiate between A+ and A- engineers.
  • Strong across every stage of the process, from sourcing to closing.
  • Excellent written English.
  • Excellent attention to detail.

Benefits

  • Work remotely - anywhere in Europe (but Europe only). No commute. Lots of flexibility. Plenty of time to care for your kids or cats.
  • Equity in a high growth startup backed by the investors of Spotify and Slack.
  • Autonomy - you decide how to achieve your best work.
